etymology.description: Phonetic: 十(十) (shí, 'ten') + Semantic: 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth') -> container with a needle; oracle bones reflect original version of 怞(怞) (yóu, 'cause') -> final form 由(由)
etymology.interpretation: The character 由(由) (yóu, 'cause') was originally a phono-semantic compound, combining 十(十) (shí, 'ten') as the phonetic component with 口(口) (kǒu, 'mouth') as the semantic component. This represents a container, indicating an ancient pronunciation. The character also has historical associations with oracle bone script and was an original form of 怞(怞) (yóu, 'cause'), indicating the character's evolution from a depiction of an item to its modern meaning.

examples.chinese: 这次事故由人为失误造成(這次事故由人為失誤造成)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì shìgù yóu rénwéi shīwù zàochéng.
examples.english: This accident was caused by human error.

examples.chinese: 他的成功由坚持与努力铸就(他的成功由堅持與努力鑄就)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de chénggōng yóu jiānchí yǔ nǔlì zhùjiù.
examples.english: His success was built on perseverance and hard work.

examples.chinese: 问题往往由细节引起(問題往往由細節引起)。
examples.english: Problems are often caused by details.
